name: Avoid classes having excessive number of derived classes(PHP)
description: This rule searches for all classes with excessive number of derived classes. A class is considered as having excessive number of derived classes if number of derived classes are more than 15.
output:
This report lists all classes with excessive number of derived classes.

This QR provides the following information:
Class full name.
rationale: A class with excessive number of derived classes is an indicator of unbalanced class hierarchy. You should consider refactoring this class hierarchy.
remediation: Review the architecture of the application.
sample:
<?php

class BaseClass {
}

Class DerivedClass1 extends BaseClass {
}

Class DerivedClass2 extends BaseClass {
}

…

Class DerivedClass16 extends BaseClass {
}

?>

qualityStandards.name: Class Element Excessive Number of Children
qualityStandards.description:
Objective
Avoid overly complex object-oriented inheritance capabilities when dealing with the number of direct children of classes

Consequence
Software that does not follow the principles of reuse requires more maintenance effort in order to propagate changes to all instances of duplicated code

Measure Element
Number of instances where the number of children of a class element (that is, its number of child classes) exceeds a threshold value. The default threshold value for number of children of a class element is 10

parameters.name: Maximum number of acceptable child classes
parameters.description: External PHP Code scanner Rule Name-PHP Mess Detector
